title: 12-Week UX/UI Design Curriculum for YC Startup Internships
description: A comprehensive curriculum for absolute beginners to become internship-ready for YC-level startups

weeks.title: UX/UI Foundations: Introduction to Design Principles
weeks.objective: Master basic design principles, user-centered thinking, and understand the difference between UX and UI design

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'What is UX?' and 'What is UI?' modules
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a 1-page summary explaining UX vs UI in your own words. Upload as PDF to planner.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'User Research' and 'User Personas' modules
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design a basic user persona for a mobile banking app. Include demographics, goals, and pain points. Export as PNG.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Wireframing' module
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a low-fidelity wireframe for a simple e-commerce product page using pen and paper or digital tool. Photograph/upload.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Prototyping' module
daily_tasks.deliverable: Build a basic interactive prototype for a login flow using Figma or similar tool. Share Figma link.

daily_tasks.description: Review Week 1 materials and complete Codecademy assessments
daily_tasks.deliverable: Answer: 'How would you approach redesigning a confusing checkout process?' Write 200-300 words.

reflection_questions: What surprised you most about UX/UI design this week?
How has your understanding of user-centered design changed?
What design principle do you find most challenging to apply?

weeks.title: Design Systems & Visual Hierarchy
weeks.objective: Learn design systems, visual hierarchy, typography, and color theory fundamentals

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Design Systems' and 'Visual Hierarchy' modules
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a mood board with 5 examples of good visual hierarchy from existing apps/websites. Include annotations.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Typography' and 'Color Theory' modules
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design a basic type scale and color palette for a health & fitness app. Show 3 variations.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Accessibility' module
daily_tasks.deliverable: Audit an existing website for accessibility issues. List 5 problems and suggest fixes.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Codecademy 'Usability Testing' module
daily_tasks.deliverable: Write a usability test script for testing a mobile app's onboarding flow. Include 5 test tasks.

daily_tasks.description: Complete remaining Codecademy modules and final project
daily_tasks.deliverable: Build a complete wireframe and prototype for a simple mobile app concept. Include user flow diagram.

reflection_questions: How do design systems improve team collaboration?
What accessibility considerations will you prioritize in future projects?
How has your design eye developed this week?

weeks.title: Practical UI Design: Exercise 1 & 2
weeks.objective: Build design instinct through hands-on exercises focusing on layout and spacing

daily_tasks.description: Complete LearnUI Exercise 1: Build a visual hierarchy
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design a 3-column blog layout with proper visual hierarchy. Include before/after comparison.

daily_tasks.description: Continue Exercise 1 and start Exercise 2: Create a proper typographic scale
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a typographic scale for headings and body text. Apply it to a sample article layout.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Exercise 2 and analyze professional examples
daily_tasks.deliverable: Redesign an existing website's typography. Compare your solution with the original.

daily_tasks.description: Study spacing and layout principles from Exercise 1
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a spacing system (4-6 sizes) and apply it to redesign a cluttered mobile screen.

daily_tasks.description: Review exercises and practice application
daily_tasks.deliverable: Apply lessons from both exercises to redesign your Week 1 wireframe. Document improvements made.

reflection_questions: How did these exercises change your approach to design?
What spacing/layout mistakes do you now notice in apps you use?
How has your confidence in visual design decisions improved?

weeks.title: Practical UI Design: Exercise 3, 4 & 5
weeks.objective: Master advanced UI concepts through hands-on exercises in color, interaction, and mobile design

daily_tasks.description: Complete LearnUI Exercise 3: Use a color palette properly
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a 5-color palette and design a mobile settings screen using only those colors.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Exercise 4: Design for different screen sizes
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design the same content for mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints. Show responsive adaptations.

daily_tasks.description: Continue Exercise 4 and start Exercise 5: Create a mobile layout
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design a mobile-first e-commerce product page with proper touch targets and navigation.

daily_tasks.description: Complete Exercise 5 and study interaction patterns
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design 3 different interaction patterns for a social media 'like' button. Include micro-interactions.

daily_tasks.description: Review all 5 exercises and create a personal design system
daily_tasks.deliverable: Compile a personal design system including colors, typography, spacing, and components from exercises.

reflection_questions: Which exercise was most challenging and why?
How have these exercises influenced your design decisions?
What UI patterns will you incorporate into future projects?

weeks.title: UX Research & User Journey Mapping
weeks.objective: Master UX research methods, user journey mapping, and empathy building techniques

daily_tasks.description: Study user research methods from LearnUX syllabus
daily_tasks.deliverable: Conduct competitive analysis of 3 similar apps. Create comparison matrix with strengths/weaknesses.

daily_tasks.description: Learn user interview techniques and survey design
daily_tasks.deliverable: Write a user interview script for a food delivery app. Include 8-10 questions and follow-up probes.

daily_tasks.description: Practice creating user personas and empathy maps
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create detailed personas for a budgeting app based on real user research data.

daily_tasks.description: Learn user journey mapping techniques
daily_tasks.deliverable: Map the complete user journey for booking a hotel room online. Include touchpoints and pain points.

daily_tasks.description: Apply research methods to a real problem
daily_tasks.deliverable: Identify a local problem and conduct basic user research. Create findings report with recommendations.

reflection_questions: How does user research change design decisions?
What biases might affect your research?
How will you incorporate user insights in future projects?

weeks.title: Information Architecture & Content Strategy
weeks.objective: Learn to organize information effectively and develop content strategies for digital products

daily_tasks.description: Study information architecture principles
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a site map for a university website. Include primary, secondary, and tertiary navigation.

daily_tasks.description: Learn card sorting and user testing for IA
daily_tasks.deliverable: Conduct a card sorting exercise for an e-commerce site. Document methodology and results.

daily_tasks.description: Practice content inventory and audit techniques
daily_tasks.deliverable: Perform content audit of a website you use frequently. Identify content gaps and redundancies.

daily_tasks.description: Learn content strategy and microcopy writing
daily_tasks.deliverable: Write microcopy for a fitness tracking app. Include onboarding, error messages, and success states.

daily_tasks.description: Apply IA and content strategy to redesign
daily_tasks.deliverable: Redesign the information architecture of a confusing website. Present before/after comparison.

reflection_questions: How does poor IA affect user experience?
What role does content play in design?
How will you approach IA in future projects?

weeks.title: Interaction Design & Micro-interactions
weeks.objective: Master interaction design patterns, micro-interactions, and animation principles

daily_tasks.description: Study interaction design patterns and principles
daily_tasks.deliverable: Document 10 common interaction patterns with examples from apps you use daily.

daily_tasks.description: Learn micro-interaction design
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design micro-interactions for form validation states (success, error, loading).

daily_tasks.description: Practice animation principles and timing
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create an animated prototype showing state changes in a toggle switch.

daily_tasks.description: Study gesture-based interactions
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design gesture interactions for a mobile photo gallery app.

daily_tasks.description: Apply interaction design to a complex flow
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design the complete interaction flow for a multi-step form with validation and feedback.

reflection_questions: How do micro-interactions enhance user experience?
What makes a good interaction feel 'right'?
How will you incorporate motion design in future work?

weeks.title: Usability Testing & Iteration
weeks.objective: Learn usability testing methodologies, data analysis, and iterative design processes

daily_tasks.description: Study usability testing methods and planning
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a complete usability test plan for a mobile shopping app. Include test objectives and methodology.

daily_tasks.description: Learn how to moderate usability tests
daily_tasks.deliverable: Write a moderator script for testing an e-commerce checkout flow.

daily_tasks.description: Practice analyzing usability test results
daily_tasks.deliverable: Analyze sample usability test data and create findings report with severity ratings.

daily_tasks.description: Learn A/B testing and quantitative methods
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design an A/B test for comparing two button designs. Include hypothesis and success metrics.

daily_tasks.description: Apply iterative design process
daily_tasks.deliverable: Take a design from Week 2 and iterate based on hypothetical user feedback. Show 3 versions.

portfolio_milestones.title: Research & Testing Portfolio
portfolio_milestones.description: Complete research methods and testing deliverables

reflection_questions: How has usability testing changed your design approach?
What metrics matter most for YC startups?
How will you incorporate user feedback in your process?

weeks.title: Design Systems & Component Libraries
weeks.objective: Build comprehensive design systems and create reusable component libraries

daily_tasks.description: Study design system principles and structure
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a design system inventory for a popular app. Document colors, typography, and components.

daily_tasks.description: Learn component library creation
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design a button component library with variants (primary, secondary, ghost) and states.

daily_tasks.description: Practice design token implementation
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create a design token system for spacing, colors, and typography scales.

daily_tasks.description: Study responsive design systems
daily_tasks.deliverable: Adapt your component library for mobile, tablet, and desktop breakpoints.

daily_tasks.description: Apply design system to a real project
daily_tasks.deliverable: Build a screen using your design system. Document component usage and rationale.

reflection_questions: How do design systems improve design consistency?
What challenges arise when implementing design systems?
How will you maintain design systems in a startup environment?

weeks.title: YC Startup Design: Product-Market Fit Focus
weeks.objective: Learn startup-specific design practices, rapid prototyping, and product-market fit validation

daily_tasks.description: Study YC startup design principles and constraints
daily_tasks.deliverable: Analyze 3 YC companies' product designs. Identify patterns in their approach to MVPs.

daily_tasks.description: Learn rapid prototyping for startups
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create 5 different MVP concepts for a local service problem. Use rapid sketching techniques.

daily_tasks.description: Practice design for growth and metrics
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design user onboarding flow optimized for conversion. Include A/B test hypotheses.

daily_tasks.description: Study startup user acquisition design
daily_tasks.deliverable: Design landing page for a hypothetical YC startup. Focus on conversion and messaging.

daily_tasks.description: Apply startup design principles to case study
daily_tasks.deliverable: Redesign an existing startup's key screen based on growth metrics and user feedback.

reflection_questions: How does startup design differ from enterprise design?
What metrics should YC startups prioritize?
How will you adapt your design process for fast-moving startups?

weeks.title: Advanced Projects & Portfolio Development
weeks.objective: Build comprehensive case studies and develop a professional portfolio for YC internships

daily_tasks.description: Create detailed case study structure
daily_tasks.deliverable: Outline a complete case study for one of your projects. Include problem, process, solution, and results.

daily_tasks.description: Develop portfolio presentation skills
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create portfolio website structure with project sections, about page, and contact information.

daily_tasks.description: Practice explaining design decisions
daily_tasks.deliverable: Record yourself explaining the design process for a recent project. Focus on rationale and trade-offs.

daily_tasks.description: Build comprehensive project documentation
daily_tasks.deliverable: Document a complete project from research to final design. Include all artifacts and rationale.

daily_tasks.description: Refine portfolio based on feedback principles
daily_tasks.deliverable: Get feedback on 2 portfolio pieces and implement improvements. Document changes made.

reflection_questions: What makes a compelling design portfolio?
How do you explain complex design decisions simply?
What gaps remain in your portfolio?

weeks.title: Internship Preparation & Final Portfolio
weeks.objective: Finalize portfolio, practice interview skills, and prepare for YC startup internships

daily_tasks.description: Research YC startup internship requirements
daily_tasks.deliverable: Create list of 10 YC startups hiring designers. Note their design challenges and requirements.

daily_tasks.description: Practice design interview questions
daily_tasks.deliverable: Complete 5 common design interview exercises: redesign, critique, whiteboarding.

daily_tasks.description: Build internship application materials
daily_tasks.deliverable: Write cover letter and update LinkedIn profile optimized for YC startup design roles.

daily_tasks.description: Finalize portfolio and case studies
daily_tasks.deliverable: Complete 3 polished case studies with final presentation. Ensure Figma files are shareable.

daily_tasks.description: Mock internship interviews and final review
daily_tasks.deliverable: Conduct mock interview with portfolio walkthrough. Record and self-assess performance.

portfolio_milestones.title: Complete Internship-Ready Portfolio
portfolio_milestones.description: Final portfolio with 3-5 case studies, resume, and application materials

reflection_questions: What have you learned about yourself as a designer?
How has your design thinking evolved over 12 weeks?
What are your goals for your first design internship?
How will you continue learning after this curriculum?
